alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Western King William (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Caroline, central Hanover and northwestern King William Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Studley to Hanover to near Ashland to near Randolph Macon College. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ashland, Randolph Macon College, Hanover, Studley, Mangohick, Dawn, Kings Dominion, Enfield, Hanover Airport, Gum Tree, Upshaw, Doswell, Elmont, Etna Mills, Epworth, Calno, Ashcake, Burruss Corner, Globe and Pollards Corner. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Eastern Hanover; Western King William
